Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Leadership, how to mediate conflict, legal issues as an officer
Leadership skills to be an effective leader and Air Force Officer
Gained valuable leadership knowledge through various accomplished guest speakers

I developed my speaking and writing skills in this class through our impromptu briefings and our persuasive paper and briefing. This helped me a great deal to get my ideas on paper or spoken in a succinct and clear manner.
We learned about how to approach different aspects of leadership and mentorship.
The course involved a lot of interesting guest speakers that really added to the experience

Strengths would be the breadth of speakers who presented. Most were extremely engaging and I always felt I walked away with new knowledge of not just the topic at hand, but life skills in general.

This is a small weakness, but accessing the readings was confusing. I personally much preferred when the readings were in the email attachment the week before class, rather than having to find the syllabus, find which week were at, see which lesson is being taught. Then having to navigate the det blog and look for the reading. I know that process in itself deterred myself and a few of my peers from even looking at the lessons.

This was an excellent course which brought in many guest speakers for many different perspectives. One area for improvement however might be to include more examples of historical leadership rather than contemporary leadership. This might boost moral and patriotism in the detachment.
The course was great because Lt Col Hermes switched up the format of classes so that we were always engaged in the material.
Yes, everyone should take a leadership class.
I would recommend this to another student, however I believe it a course specifically for Air Force ROTC students so I'm not sure how applicable it would be to other Yale students.
